book.sculktransporting.subtitle: 由Redstone_Dubstand, bl4ck编写
book.sculktransporting.landing_text: 在本指南中，您将了解有关建造幽匿运输系统的所有信息，以使用幽匿的神秘力量运输物品。
book.sculktransporting.gathering_resourc: 建造一个最基本的幽匿运输系统是相对便宜的，只需要很少的材料，例如$(item)铁$()、$(item)金$()或$(item)红石$()。然而它也需要一些只能在地下的$(thing)深暗之域$()生物群系找到的材料，这个生物群系会罕见地在靠近世界底部的区域生成。
$(item)深板岩$()可以在世界上高度0以下的所有区域找到。它可以使用任意$(thing)镐$()采集，可以使用$(thing)工作台$()或$(thing)切石机$()制作成$(item)深板岩砖$()。
$(item)幽匿块$()是大多数配方所必需的材料，通常在$(thing)深暗之域$()生物群系找到。类似幽匿家族的其他方块，挖掘它最快的工具是$(thing)锄$()，但只能通过使用附有$(thing)精准采集$()的工具获取。
$(item)幽匿脉络$()是用于合成$(l:sculktransporting:sculk_barrel)$(item)幽匿桶$()的材料，通常可在$(thing)深暗之域$()生物群系中的幽匿斑块附近找到。你需要一个附有$(thing)精准采集$()的工具才能获取此原料。

$(item)幽匿感测体$()是$(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)幽匿发送器$()和$(l:sculktransporting:sculk_receiver)$(item)幽匿接收器$()的基本原料，可罕见地在幽匿斑块中找到，并且需要$(thing)精准采集$()来获得。在这些感测体周围时请小心一点，别吸引到任何一只$(thing)监守者$()！
如果你想用不同的组件，例如$(l:sculktransporting:quantity_modifiers)$(item)数量组件$()或$(l:sculktransporting:speed_modifiers)$(item)速度组件$()，来强化你的幽匿运输系统，你需要获取$(thing)更多的材料$()来制作它们，其中有一些是无法直接获得的。
$(item)凝灰岩$()是制作$(l:sculktransporting:speed_modifiers)$(item)速度组建$()的必备原料，在世界高度16以下的地方成簇生成，也会生成在$(thing)铁矿脉$()附近，铁矿脉会在高度0以下小概率生成。凝灰岩可以用任意$(thing)镐$()采集。
$(item)平滑玄武岩$()是制作$(l:sculktransporting:quantity_modifiers)$(item)数量组件$()的必备原料。你可以在$(thing)紫水晶洞$()的外壳中找到它，它们在地底下很罕见，在$(thing)古代城市$()的一些建筑中也能发现。任意的$(thing)镐$()都可以采集。
$(item)生铁块$()用于制作更高级的组件， 它可以用9块$(item)生铁$()来$(thing)制作$()，也可以在$(thing)铁矿脉$()中找到它，铁矿脉会在高度0以下小概率生成。$(item)生铁块$()跟$(item)铁矿石$()一样，只可以用$(thing)石镐及以上的镐$()采集。

$(item)Sculk Catalysts$() are ingredients of higher tier modifiers, and can be found rarely inside Sculk patches in the $(thing)Deep Dark$() biome, where it can only be obtained using a tool enchanted with $(thing)Silk Touch$(). They are also dropped by $(thing)Wardens$(), in the rare occasions of them dying.

$(item)Sculk Shriekers$() are used to craft modifiers of the highest tier, and can be found rarely inside Sculk patches in the $(thing)Deep Dark$() biome. Obtaining them requires a tool enchanted with $(thing)Silk Touch$(). Be careful when being near these blocks, since they have the ability to spawn a $(thing)Warden$() if there is a $(item)Sculk Sensor$() in the vicinity!

$(item)Echo Shards$() are used to craft modifiers of the highest tier, and can only be found in chests within $(thing)Ancient Cities$(). These structures generate at the bottom of the world inside the $(thing)Deep Dark$() biome, and feature many dangers such as $(thing)Wardens$(), so extra caution is necessary when looting them.
book.sculktransporting.sculk_emitter.pag: The $(item)Sculk Emitter$() is one of the key parts required for a sculk transporting system. It automatically takes items from a $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_barrel)$(item)Sculk Barrel$() beneath, converts them into a sculk signal, and sends them to any nearby $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_transmitter)$(item)Sculk Transmitters$() or $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_receiver)$(item)Receivers$(). If there are none nearby, it will store the item until it finds a recipient. It emits a $(thing)strength 15$() redstone signal if it contains an item.

Their signals can travel up to $(thing)8 blocks$(), with a speed of $(thing)20 blocks per second$(), and can be occluded with $(thing)Wool$() and similar blocks. $(p)Depending on how many items are stored in the $(item)Sculk Emitter$(), it will output a comparator signal of $(thing)1 to 15$(). The strength increases linearly with the amount of items. $(p)Example: If there are $(thing)16 items$() stored, the comparator will have a signal strength of $(thing)4$().
book.sculktransporting.sculk_emitter.cra: The $(item)Sculk Emitter$() can be modified with $(l:sculktransporting:quantity_modifiers)$(item)Quantity Modifiers$() or $(l:sculktransporting:speed_modifiers)$(item)Speed Modifiers$(). By default, it is able to pick up and store $(thing)1 item$() every $(thing)$(t:20 ticks)1 second$().
book.sculktransporting.sculk_emitter.pag: To change which blocks the $(item)Sculk Emitter$() can take items from, datapacks can modify the $(thing)sculktransporting:sculk_emitter_can_take_from$() block tag.
book.sculktransporting.sculk_barrel.page: The $(item)Sculk Barrel$() is another required block for transporting items through sculk signals. It mostly acts like a normal barrel, but is the only container a $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitter$() can take items out from. It also makes for a fitting storage solution for all sculk-themed builds!
book.sculktransporting.sculk_barrel.craf: The modifiers cannot be added to this block. Thus, a $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitter$()'s speed is not limited by the $(item)Sculk Barrel$().
book.sculktransporting.sculk_receiver.pa: The $(item)Sculk Receiver$() is the last block required for item transportation. It can take signals from $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitters$() or $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_transmitter)$(item)Transmitters$() and attempts to put the item in a container beneath. If that fails, the block will store the item until a suitable container is found.

Note: Due to the $(item)Sculk Receiver$() using a hopper for item insertion, the container below it does $(l)$(#f00)not$(0)$() need to be a $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_barrel)$(item)Sculk Barrel$(). $(p)Depending on how many items are stored in the $(item)Sculk Receiver$(), it will output a comparator signal of $(thing)1 to 15$(). The strength increases linearly with the amount of items. $(p)Example: If there are $(thing)16 items$() stored, the comparator will have a signal strength of $(thing)4$().
book.sculktransporting.sculk_receiver.cr: The $(item)Sculk Receiver$() can be modified with $(l:sculktransporting:speed_modifiers)$(item)Speed Modifiers$(). By default, it is able to deposit all stored items every $(thing)$(t:20 ticks)1 second$().
book.sculktransporting.sculk_transmitter: The $(item)Sculk Transmitter$() does not need to be included in every sculk transporting system, however it is mandatory for item transportation over longer distances. Similar to a $(thing)Repeater$(), it is able to receive signals from $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitters$() or other $(item)Transmitters$() and tries to re-broadcast them to other $(item)Sculk Transmitters$() or $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_receiver)$(item)Receivers$() nearby.

It can be set to only accept one type of item, by $(thing)right-clicking$() it with that item. As long as it displays an item, only that item will get sent to that $(item)Transmitter$(). This behavior can be inverted, by $(thing)right-clicking$() the $(item)Sculk Transmitter$() with an empty hand, resulting in it accepting $(thing)$(l)every item except$() the one being displayed. The filter can be cleared by $(thing)sneak right-clicking$() the $(item)Transmitter$() with an empty hand.
A $(item)Sculk Transmitter$(), with its filter set to allow $(thing)everything but bones$(). Note the $(thing)red pixels$() above the item, indicating an $(thing)inverted filter$().

Their signals can travel up to $(thing)8 blocks$(), with a speed of $(thing)20 blocks per second$(), and can be occluded with $(thing)Wool$() and similar blocks. $(p)Depending on how many items are stored in the $(item)Sculk Transmitter$(), it will output a comparator signal of $(thing)1 to 15$(). The strength increases linearly with the amount of items. $(p)Example: If there are $(thing)16 items$() stored, the comparator will have a signal strength of $(thing)4$().
$(item)Sculk Transmitters$() cannot be modified, as they already work with maximum efficiency.
book.sculktransporting.quantity_modifier: $(item)Quantity Modifiers$() can be inserted into $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitters$(), and allow the block to pick up and store a greater quantity of items. With one of these modifiers, a $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitter$() is able to pick up more items at once from the $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_barrel)$(item)Sculk Barrel$() below. $(p)There are $(thing)3 different Quantity Modifiers$() with an increasing level of item capacity bonus.
The $(item)Quantity Modifier (Tier 1)$() is the most basic quantity modifier, and is able to increase the block's item capacity to $(thing)4 items$().
The $(item)Quantity Modifier (Tier 2)$() is capable of increasing the block's item capacity to $(thing)16 items$().
The $(item)Quantity Modifier (Tier 3)$(), being the most advanced quantity modifier, will increase the block's item capacity to $(thing)64 items$().

To insert a $(thing)Quantity Modifier$(), simply $(thing)right-click$() the block while holding the modifier in your hand. $(br)Because a $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitter$() can also take $(l:sculktransporting:speed_modifiers)$(item)Speed Modifiers$(), removing a $(thing)Quantity Modifier$() will require $(thing)sneak right-clicking$() the $(l)right half$() of the block's side with an empty hand.
A $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitter$(), modified with a $(item)Quantity Modifier (Tier 2)$().
book.sculktransporting.speed_modifiers.p: $(item)Speed Modifiers$() can be inserted into $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitters$() and $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_receiver)$(item)Receivers$(). They are able to decrease the delay between the respective block's actions, such as sending a signal, or depositing items below. With one of these modifiers, a $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitter$() will pick up items, as well as try to send a signal faster than normal. Do note, that due to $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_transmitter)$(item)Sculk Transmitters$() already working as fast as

they can, there may be additional delays introduced. This can lead to the $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitter$() not working at full capacity. $(br)A $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_receiver)$(item)Sculk Receiver$() with an installed $(thing)Speed Modifier$() is able to deposit its stored item faster to the container below. $(p)There are $(thing)4 different Speed Modifiers$() with an increasing level of speed boost.
book.sculktransporting.speed_modifiers.c: The $(item)Speed Modifier (Tier 1)$() is the most basic speed modifier, and is able to increase the block's speed to one action every $(thing)$(t:3/4 seconds)15 ticks$().
The $(item)Speed Modifier (Tier 2)$() is able to increase the block's speed to one action every $(thing)$(t:1/2 seconds)10 ticks$().
The $(item)Speed Modifier (Tier 3)$() is capable of increasing the block's speed to one action every $(thing)$(t:1/4 seconds)5 ticks$().

The $(item)Speed Modifier (Tier 4)$() is the most advanced speed modifier. It will cause the block to do one action $(thing)$(t:1/20 seconds)every tick$(), however an item may be received and deposited, or extracted and sent respectively, $(thing)within the same tick$().
book.sculktransporting.speed_modifiers.p: To insert a $(thing)Speed Modifier$(), simply $(thing)right-click$() the block while holding the modifier in your hand. $(br)Removing it from a $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_receiver)$(item)Sculk Receiver$() is as simple as $(thing)sneak right-clicking$() the block with an empty hand. However, because a $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_emitter)$(item)Sculk Emitter$() can also take $(l:sculktransporting:quantity_modifiers)$(item)Quantity Modifiers$(), removing a $(thing)Speed Modifier$() from it will require $(thing)sneak right-clicking$() the $(l)left half$() of the block's side with an empty hand.
book.sculktransporting.speed_modifiers.i: A $(l:sculktransporting:sculk_receiver)$(item)Sculk Receiver$(), modified with a $(item)Speed Modifier (Tier 4)$().
